meanings.definition: To remove a sling or slings from (something)
meanings.sent1: He unslings his backpack before sitting down.
meanings.sent2: She unslings the camera from her shoulder after taking a photo.
meanings.sent3: The knight unslings his sword, ready for battle.
meanings.sent4: The mechanic unslings the tool belt, prepared to fix the car.
meanings.sent5: The hiker unslings the heavy pack, relieved to feel lighter.

meanings.definition: To take a sling or slings off (something)
meanings.sent1: The soldier unslings the rifle carefully.
meanings.sent2: He unslings the guitar from his back to start playing.
meanings.sent3: The superhero unslings the cape, revealing their true identity.
meanings.sent4: She unslings the necklace, feeling free from its weight.
meanings.sent5: The worker unslings the hammer, ready to begin construction.
